Deal of the Week: Scrivener writing program for PC or Mac (51% off)   9, 2015 in ghacks   9, 2015 0 
Scrivener is a writing program that has been designed to assist in the creation of long and complex documents such as novels, research papers, screen plays, scripts or any other structured text that requires more than writing from top to bottom until it is done. 
Lots of thought went into the program and some of the features that it makes available improve how you work with documents significantly. 
Scrivener allows you for instance to work with multiple documents at the same time by combining them into a single text and to manage collections of documents and texts to keep an overview. 
Other features include a custom script writing mode for screen and stage play formatting, the automatic creation of snapshots, a name generator, or outliner support that helps you structure your document before you start writing. Click here to open the Scrivener page on Ghacks Deals 
Ever tried writing a novel in Microsoft Word? Trust us, you don’t want to. That’s why writing professionals around the world use Scrivener, the word processor and project management tool that stays with you from your first, unformed idea all the way through to the final draft. As you’re writing, outline your ideas, take notes, and view research all at once. Scrivener takes all the tools you have scattered around your desk and makes them available in one application. View & edit different sections of your writing in isolation or as a whole Take a “snapshot” of a document, then edit & rewrite knowing you can restore an earlier revision at any time Easily storyboard & rearrange your project Utilize the fully-featured outliner to take control of the structure of your work Switch to scriptwriting mode for automatic or custom formatting—then export to a dedicated scriptwriting program such as Final Draft Use the name generator to create pseudonyms for interviewees or names for fictional characters Automatically back up your projects as zip files each time you open or close them Make sure you check out the frontpage on Ghacks Deals for a list of recent software, e-learning and gadget deals, and the Freebies section which lists all zero-cost deals on the site.
